articles.title: The sun is going to DIE... but don't worry it won't happen for another 5 billion years, ESA predicts - Daily Mail
articles.description: The European Space Agency has predicted the future of our sun - it will will start on a path of destruction in at least 5 billion years when it reaches its maximum temperature.
articles.content: The European Space Agency's (ESA) Gaia spacecraft has made a chilling prediction that our sun is almost halfway through its life span and when it reaches the end, it will swell and obliterate our pla… [+7214 chars]

articles.author: Rhiannon Du Cann
articles.title: Archaeology breakthrough: Scientists discover remains of NEW dinosaur the size of a CAT - Express
articles.description: ARCHAEOLOGISTS unearthed an incredible discovery after they found a new type of dinosaur that roamed the Earth on its hind legs more than 100 million years ago. And what's even more fascinating is the species is only the size of a household pet.

articles.author: Sam Tonkin
articles.title: Astronaut snaps 'spectacular' pictures of aurora from the International Space Station - Daily Mail
articles.description: US astronaut Bob Hines, who snapped the amazing images, tweeted: 'SPECTACULAR aurora today!!! Thankful for the recent solar activity resulting in these wonderful sights!'
articles.content:
Spectacular images of the Northern Lights have been captured by an astronaut onboard the International Space Station.

articles.author: Antony Ashkenaz
articles.title: Solar storm: UK alert as Earth faces 'glancing blows' – sun erupts with 'dozens' of flares - Express
articles.description: THE EARTH continues to be pummeling by solar storms as space experts warn that we could face dozens more impacts over the next few days - and aurora could be visible in the UK.
